channel.title: Javascript on Today I learned

item.title: Javascript
item.description: Callback functions They are derived from a programming paradigm known as functional programmings A callback function, also known as a higher-order function, is a function that is passed to another function Eg: $("#btn_1").click(function() { alert("Btn 1 Clicked"); }); Functional programming (often abbreviated FP) is the process of building software by composing pure functions, avoiding shared state, mutable data, and side-effects A pure function is a function which: Given the same inputs, always returns the same output, and Has no side-effects
